init
====

The ``fujin init`` command initializes a new project with a ``fujin.toml`` configuration file.

.. image:: ../_static/images/help/init-help.png
   :alt: fujin init command help
   :width: 100%

Overview
--------

Use ``fujin init`` to quickly bootstrap your project configuration. It generates a ``fujin.toml`` file with sensible defaults based on your project type.

The command supports different profiles for common frameworks:

- **simple** - Basic Python package
- **django** - Django applications
- **falco** - Falco framework applications
- **binary** - Self-contained binary deployments

Optionally, it can also generate template files in a ``.fujin/`` directory that you can customize.

Examples
--------

Example of configuration files generated by the ``init`` command for different profiles.

.. tab-set::

    .. tab-item:: simple

        .. exec_code::
            :language_output: toml

            # --- hide: start ---
            from fujin.commands.init import simple_config
            from tomli_w import dumps

            print(dumps(simple_config("bookstore"),  multiline_strings=True))
            #hide:toggle

    .. tab-item:: django

        .. exec_code::
            :language_output: toml

            # --- hide: start ---
            from fujin.commands.init import django_config
            from tomli_w import dumps

            print(dumps(django_config("bookstore"),  multiline_strings=True))
            #hide:toggle

    .. tab-item:: falco

        .. exec_code::
            :language_output: toml

            # --- hide: start ---
            from fujin.commands.init import falco_config
            from tomli_w import dumps

            print(dumps(falco_config("bookstore"),  multiline_strings=True))
            #hide:toggle

    .. tab-item:: binary
         
        .. exec_code::
            :language_output: toml

            # --- hide: start ---
            from fujin.commands.init import binary_config
            from tomli_w import dumps

            print(dumps(binary_config("bookstore"),  multiline_strings=True))
            #hide:toggle
